fields.name: Chest
fields.description: The chest muscles, primarily the pectoralis major and minor, are crucial for upper body strength and pushing movements.

fields.name: Back
fields.description: The back muscles include the latissimus dorsi, trapezius, and rhomboids, essential for pulling movements and posture.

fields.name: Legs
fields.description: Leg muscles including quadriceps, hamstrings, calves, and glutes are critical for lower body strength and mobility.

fields.name: Shoulders
fields.description: Shoulder muscles, including the deltoids, are vital for upper body mobility and overhead movements.

fields.name: Arms
fields.description: Arm muscles including biceps, triceps, and forearms are essential for pulling, pushing, and grip strength.

fields.name: Core
fields.description: Core muscles including abdominals and lower back are crucial for stability, posture, and overall body strength.

fields.name: Glutes
fields.description: Gluteal muscles are key for hip extension, rotation, and are critical in lower body power generation and stability.

fields.name: Forearms
fields.description: Forearm muscles control wrist and finger movements, crucial for grip strength and fine motor skills in various exercises.

fields.name: Calves
fields.description: Calf muscles are essential for ankle movement, jumping, and provide stability during walking, running, and various lower body exercises.

fields.name: Neck
fields.description: Neck muscles support head movement, maintain posture, and play a critical role in stabilizing the cervical spine during physical activities.
